what: Optimizing Machine Learning Models through Sample Size Variation in Training Subsets
title: Optimizing Machine Learning Models through Sample Size Variation in Training Subsets
text: package machine learning debugging based sample size analysis.

what: Progressive Split of Dataset for Model Evaluation — progressive_split
title: Progressive Split of Dataset for Model Evaluation — progressive_split
text: Dynamically partitions dataset training validation subsets, allowing evaluation machine learning model performance across varying sample sizes.

title: Progressive Split of Dataset for Model Evaluation — progressive_split
Progressive Split of Dataset for Model Evaluation — progressive_split
text: data data frame containing dataset split. validation_size numeric value 0 1 indicating proportion dataset used validation set. Default 0.2. start_size integer indicating initial size training set. Must least 1 less number rows dataset minus size validation set. Default 2.

title: Progressive Split of Dataset for Model Evaluation — progressive_split
text: object class 'rset' containing training validation splits iteration increasing training set size.

title: Progressive Split of Dataset for Model Evaluation — progressive_split
code: # Example usage: data(iris) splits <- progressive_split(iris, validation_size = 0.2, start_size = 10)
